'''''Härskarringen''''' ("The Ruling Ring") is the name of [[Åke Ohlmarks]]'s translation into Swedish of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.
==History==
While the work as a whole is popularly known as '''''Sagan om ringen''''' in Sweden (and sometimes also titled so by the publishers), this is properly the title of the translation (published in [[1959]]) of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''. In [[1960]] followed '''''Sagan om de två tornen''''' (''[[The Two Towers]]''), and in [[1961]] '''''Sagan om konungens återkomst''''' (''[[The Return of the King]]'').<ref name="Beregond">{{webcite|author=[[Anders Stenström|Beregond, Anders Stenström]]|articleurl=http://tolkiensarda.se/new/nummer/magsidor/art26_1.php|articlename=Tolkien i svensk översättning: Från ''Hompen'' till ''Ringarnas herre''|dated=|website=[http://tolkiensarda.se/ TolkiensArda.se]|accessed=14 June 2013}}</ref>

''Härskarringen'' was the second translation of ''The Lord of the Rings'' (the first being the Dutch translation by [[Max Schuchart]], ''In de Ban van de Ring'').<ref>{{CG|RG}} , entry "Translations"</ref>

A second Swedish translation of ''The Lord of the Rings'' came in 2004-5: ''Ringarnas herre'', translated by [[Erik Andersson]].<ref>{{webcite|author=Charline Erliksson|articleurl=http://www.ne.se/rep/%C3%B6vers%C3%A4ttningar-ringarnas-herre-utmanad|articlename=Översättningar: Ringarnas herre utmanad|dated=30 April 2008|website=[http://www.ne.se/ NE.se]|accessed=14 June 2013}}</ref>

==Critical reception==
:''See: [[Åke Ohlmarks#Ohlmarks and Tolkien|Åke Ohlmarks: Ohlmarks and Tolkien]]''

In a [[Letter to H.W. Donner|letter of July 1960]], Tolkien expresses his dislike for the cover art for ''Sagan om ringen'', since it contradicts the text.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Christina Scull]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]]|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=14 June 2013}}</ref>
